Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Vermilion Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Vermilion Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Rd Dist#4 of Rd Dist#2 -- 8.61 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-Road District No. 4 of Road District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 8.61 mills tax for a period of 10 years in Sub-Road District No. 4 of Road District No. 2 for the purpose of constructing and improving public roads and highways within said Sub-Road District, or for the maintenance thereof.
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-Road District No. 4 of Road District No. 2 of the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana (the "Sub-Road District"), continue to levy an eight and sixty-one (8.61) mills tax on all property subject to taxation within said Sub-Road District (an estimated $335,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of constructing and improving public roads and highways within said Sub-Road District, or for the maintenance thereof, said millage to represent a thirty-five hundredths of a mill (.35) increase over the 8.26 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2011 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2001?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Dist.#5 Guey.DD Prop.#1 -- 7.69 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 7.69 mills tax continuation for maintaining gravity drainage works within and for Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District.
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District of the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of seven and sixty-nine hundredths (7.69) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $157,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of maintaining gravity drainage works within and for said District, said millage to represent an eighty-seven hundredths of a mill (.87) increase over the 6.82 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2011 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2001?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Dist.#5 Guey.DD Prop.#2 -- 3.59 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 3.59 mills tax continuation for maintaining gravity drainage works within and for Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District.
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-District No. 5 of the Gueydan Drainage District of the Parish of Vermilion, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of three and fifty-nine hundredths (3.59) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $73,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of maintaining gravity drainage works within and for said District, said millage to represent a forty-one hundredths of a mill (.41) increase over the 3.18 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2011 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2001?
